content.question: In the desert regions of the southwestern United States, daily high and low temperatures will frequently fluctuate by <math alttext="40 degrees Fahrenheit" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>40</mn><mi>°</mi><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="33 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>33</mn><mi>°</mi><mi>C</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> or more. Which statement below best explains the large variation in temperature?

choices.label: There are no bordering oceans or large bodies of water to provide a stabilizing humidity to the air.
The nearby Rocky Mountain range provides a rain shadow effect in the evenings to the west.
The flat, light-colored sand formations typical in deserts reflect light from the Sun during the day, but not at night.
Desert plants have long tap roots that pull water from deep in the soil, cooling the desert at night.

content.answer: There are no bordering oceans or large bodies of water to provide a stabilizing humidity to the air.
